name: Ready Responders
description_html: Ready delivers non-emergency care solutions that meet people where they are. Weâ€™ll send a local Responder to you and set up a video chat with a clinician who can provide immediate, non-emergency care.
overview: At Ready, I worked as a Senior Backend Engineer to help lead the effort in designing and implementing the back-end and API for a modular, task based EMR from the ground up using PostgreSQL, Typescript, GraphQL, Kubernetes, AWS.

name: EquipmentShare
description_html:
EquipmentShare offers machine rentals to companies all over the country and parts of the world. Their technology makes it easier to lease and track equipment rentals and they've been a disruptive leader in the industry for years.

I joined the Data Ops team at EquipmentShare as a Senior Data Engineer. Our team's primary focus was to build and maintain a streaming pipeline into our Snowflake Data Warehouse.
overview: As a Senior Data Engineer at EquipmentShare our primary responsiblity was to build, maintain and support our main data warehouse. I helped architect and build a real-time streaming pipeline using AWS Kinesis Streams and Lambdas to stream billions of recorsd into Snowflake.

name: Dunami Inc.
description_html:
Dunami provides high level analytical solutions for finding relevant audiences, and identifying those with the most influence within a network.

During my time at Dunami I worked as a front-end engineer on a highly complex AngularJS application for two years. After that time I was promoted to UI/UX team lead and worked on architecting and building a new single page application in React and Redux.

I also played a key role in migrating a large scale .Net application into a containerized Node JS microservice architecture with a GraphQL api gateway.
overview: As the UI/UX team lead I was responsible for building and maintaing multiple large-scale single page applications in AngularJS and React / Redux.
I designed and created multiple interactive data visualizations using D3, HTML5 and CSS3.
Along with my other team members, we undertook and completed a large project to transform a monolithic .Net application to Node JS microservices.
I architected and implemented an Api Gateway in Node JS using GraphQL as the application interface.
Our team worked to develop, publish and maintain multiple NPM modules for collaborative use around our organization.

name: Freightview
description_html:
Freightview is a SaaS company that allows users to compare and choose the best rates from multiple providers.

As a full-stack javascript developer I was heavily involved in the development, refactoring, testing and releasing of both front-end and back-end features.
overview: Worked in the front-end using Javascript, HTML, CSS and Bootstrap.JS to develop features, refactor existing code, and improve the overall design of the application.
Architected and developed features in the backend using Node JS and MongoDB.
Helped to implement real-time updates and alerts using Socket.IO and Redis.

name: Ad Astra Information Systems
description_html:
Ad Astra Information Systems is a software company that offers several solutions in the higher education scheduling and analytics space. They focus on helping colleges and universities effectively manage finite space and resources.

I was placed in junior dev role, where I worked on code refactoring and bug fixing in both the front-end. I also developed a liking an aptitude for working on their propriety analytical algorithms for predicting student outcomes.
overview: Developed high quality code in a professional environment.
Worked to enhance the design and functionality of a web based, Single-Page Application using JavaScript and Ext JS.
Worked to improve stability and performance in sophisticated back-end systems.
Contributed extensively to refactoring database systems and SQL stored procedures for performance increases.
Collaborated with developers and product managers to provide creative and innovative solutions for clients.

name: University of Kansas
description_html: Masters of Computer Science in Computer Engineering
overview: Pursued a Masters of Computer Science in Computer Engineer
Completed coursework in Information Retrieval, Software Systems, Operating Systems, Data Structures and Advanced Graduate Algorithms.

name: Missouri State Univerity
overview: Completed a Bachelor of Science in Engineering Physics with a Minor in Mathematics
